summary: This document is a series of emails from June 2019 between FBI personnel and a Victim Witness Coordinator from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails discuss preparations for an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on identifying and entering victim information into the Victim Notification System (VNS) to ensure victims are notified of their rights.

persons.name: Olsen
persons.context: A Victim Witness Coordinator from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is emphasizing the importance of having all victim information ready in the Victim Notification System for when charges are filed against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Monroe
persons.context: Referred to as the case agent for the Epstein investigation, whom an FBI agent reached out to regarding victim information.

connections.description: Olsen instructs that Monroe should have all relevant victim information, indicating a professional working relationship in the Epstein case preparation.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein victim list
events.description: FBI and SDNY personnel exchange emails about preparing a list of 31 identified victims for entry into the Victim Notification System ahead of an anticipated arrest.

events.title: SDNY directive on victim notification preparedness
events.description: Victim Witness Coordinator Olsen sends an email stressing the imperative that all identified victims be entered into VNS so they can be notified when charges are filed.

events.title: FBI agent's return from Oklahoma
events.description: An FBI agent mentions being out of the office until July 3, 2019, and requests victim data exports until that date to ensure victim notification compliance.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing for an imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein in late June 2019.
31 names of victims had been identified, but most lacked contact information, and some had declined interviews or were advised by attorneys not to discuss the case.

There was a coordinated effort between the FBI and SDNY's Victim Witness unit to ensure all victims were entered into the Victim Notification System (VNS) to comply with federal victim notification laws upon arrest.
The emails highlight the procedural focus on victim rights notification ahead of the public announcement of charges.
